trustfund:
TF050093-GEF2 PDF B -
            MOLDOVA:PREPARATION OF AGRICULTURAL POLLUTION CONTROL PROJ

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Moldova Agricultural Pollution Control Project, which
            provides a mix of investment and policy-related activities
            to mainstream environmental practices into the agricultural
            sector. This report describes anticipated negative
            environmental impacts and their mitigations. They are as
            follows: Develop and implement improved manure management
            and environmentally sound agricultural management practices.
            Undertake a rigorous surface water quality monitoring
            program. Reduce nutrient leaching to groundwater quality by
            introducing better manure storage and handling, and nutrient
            management practices. Improve drinking water quality by
            reducing nitrate and bacteria in groundwater through
            collecting manure from individual farmer's homesteads
            and storing in communal platforms. Monitor groundwater
            quality to determine the effect of better nutrient
            management practices. Monitor soil to establish the effect
            of better farming systems on soil erosion and soil and water
            quality. Monitor the increase of flora and fauna resulting
            from the decrease of chemical and fecal material. Observe
            impact on new animal populations and soil worm and microbial
            activity. Measure effects on soil organic matter and carbon
            contents, and possibly water quality.
